Class ChainedRegime.Modifiable<M extends ChainedRegime.Modifiable<M>>

java.lang.Object
net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.regimes.ChainedRegime
net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.regimes.ChainedRegime.Modifiable<M>
Type Parameters:
M - the concrete builder subtype (for fluent chaining)
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<Regime>, Regime
Direct Known Subclasses:
ChainedRegime.BottomUpChainer, ChainedRegime.TopDownChainer
Enclosing class:
ChainedRegime
@TemplateMethod protected abstract static class ChainedRegime.Modifiable<M extends ChainedRegime.Modifiable<M>> extends ChainedRegime
Abstract base for creating fluent builders of ChainedRegime.

This class is not used directly; instead, concrete subclasses such as ChainedRegime.TopDownChainer and ChainedRegime.BottomUpChainer extend it to provide a fluent DSL for assembling training regimes. It maintains a list of chained regimes and a targetRegime pointer so that each newly added decorator can wrap the current top of the chain.

Fluent methods such as epochs(int), miniBatch(int), and reportObjective() add specific Regime decorators around the current target, enabling expressive construction of complex training pipelines without manual wiring.

Once the chain is complete, build() produces an immutable ChainedRegime that can be passed to a Trainer.

See Also:
  • ChainedRegime.TopDownChainer
  • ChainedRegime.BottomUpChainer

    • build

      protected final ChainedRegime build()
      Finalizes the builder and creates an immutable ChainedRegime.

      The returned ChainedRegime contains the current list of decorators in the order they were added. The underlying list is wrapped with List.copyOf(java.util.Collection) to ensure immutability, so further modifications to this builder will not affect the built chain.

      Returns:
      an immutable ChainedRegime representing the current builder state
      See Also:
      • ChainedRegime
